solution_line_template: If Peter's age is currently half of his mother's age, who is {mother_age}, Peter is 1/{peter_age_fraction_denominator}*{mother_age} = <<{peter_current_age}={peter_current_age}>>{peter_current_age} years old.
In {years_in_future} years, Peter will be {peter_current_age}+{years_in_future} = <<{peter_current_age}+{years_in_future}={peter_age_in_four_years}>>{peter_age_in_four_years} years old.

Since Peter's age in {years_in_future} years will be twice Harriet's age, Harriet will be {peter_age_in_four_years}/{harriet_age_multiplier} = <<{peter_age_in_four_years}/{harriet_age_multiplier}={harriet_age_in_four_years}>>{harriet_age_in_four_years} years old in {years_in_future} years.
